title: Old Judges from REA Lot 61--Images Added
author: oldjudge

posts.post_title: Old Judges from REA Lot 61--Images Added
posts.post_content:
Many cards from this lot are available(not the Baldwin). Check it out at the auction web site and if you have interest in specific cards please contact me at [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url]

Thanks---Jay
i could not find the list of cards lol...

[quote name="benderbroeth" post=999377]i could not find the list of cards lol...[/QUOTE]

[url]http://bid.robertedwardauctions.com/bidplace.aspx?itemid=21712[/url]

A few suggestions have come in to add images soooooooooo. BTW, Buster Hoover is a scarce card. Note-The Dailey-Philadelphia is an 1887 variation with the UR corner number missing. Also, note that the Comiskey Browns Champ in Goodwin is already at almost $1000 with the vig. Compare the one here with it and see how they compare.
Goodwin Comiskey Browns Champ is over $1400. The Comiskey Browns Champ offered herein, what looks to me to be a much better looking copy, is $1200. Buy smart!
Jay, I think your scanner is on the fritz! :)  Here is the scan from REA...  Definitely a beauty
Thanks Matt! My scanner is horrible. The only positive is when people get cards from me they are usually favorably surprised.

[quote name="oldjudge" post=999166]Many cards from this lot are available(not the Baldwin).[/QUOTE]

I'll take the Baldwin.

[quote name="Paul S" post=1004982]I'll take the Baldwin.[/QUOTE]



Me too!!!!
I wish I had three and could help both you guys out.
